course.subject: CIVL
course.name: Introduction to Rock Mechanics
course.description: This course introduces basic concepts of rock mechanics applied to geotechnical engineering; topics includes: index properties and classification of rocks, rock strength and failure criteria, initial stresses in rocks, rock mass properties, underground openings in rocks, rock slopes, rock foundations and stabilization of rock mass.

reviews.comment_teaching: The Prof. taught almost every lecture and tutorial himself, except one tutorial was conducted by TA. During the tutorial session, Prof. will teach something that is related to HW and he is very willing to give some hints if students ask. During lecture, Prof. always use some drawings to illustrate the abstract concept. Sometimes he shows the rock sample in front of the camera or even use the hammer to break different kinds of rock in order to demonstrate the texture of the rock. It is quite funny.
reviews.comment_grading:
Prof. said the curve is quite stable every year, half A and half B.

No mid-term. Only 5 HW and final.
Each HW is 10 points and total is 50 points (50%); final is 50%, with 100 points.

For HW, almost everyone got full mark. If you want to have a good grade, better to get full marks in HW.

Finally my score is 77.5%, got B+
reviews.comment_workload: There will be around one HW for each chapter. Sometimes one HW for two consecutive chapter, it depends on the progress of lecture and tutorial. The HW is quite similar to the tutorial example and it is easy to find the solution in lecture notes as well.

reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. Wang 教得唔錯
不過上堂就無geology個時咁funny

佢都會親自拎tracing paper畫一次

而assignment workload中等
有4份 每份嘅step都比較長
畫stereonet都唔止畫1-2次
不過睇返notes都會識做嘅
Assignment可能需要多少少時間完成

考試方面溫既workload中等
好在無midterm exam同埋係open book
但呢個course嘅內容都幾多
有好多林林種種嘅formula
要熟唔同concept
尤其是點畫stereonet
同埋點用stereonet答問題
呢到有30-40分 唔可以miss
雖然open-book
但考試時間都有啲緊
題目唔算好深

reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Wang's teaching was clear and illustrative.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading scheme:
Homework and Quiz: 50% (no late submission)
Final Exam: 50%

Almost full mark in assignments
The score of final exam is never released, I left one question totally blank out of seven, got A- finally
reviews.comment_workload:
It was said that there would be pop quizzes but there wasn't any, and lecture videos were provided, so feel free to skip the classes (esp. when the fyp deadline is coming up)

Four assignments in total, and you should have two weeks to work on each. The question types are similar to those in the tutorial sessions (with solution keys), should not be a problem if you have watch through all the tutorial videos (I got almost full mark even if I don't have sources)

Open book final exam, three hours in total, some questions are similar to those in the assignments, make sure you really know how to do the assignments (esp. for the stereonet projections). Remember to bring your own compass and tracing paper!
